page.title: 16Comparing Housing
page.content: There are a number of different types of houses in Thurcroft.Many of them are red brick terraced houses built in the 1920's.These houses have small front gardens with a back yard.In the yard there are the outside toilets. The houses are of different sizes.Some have 2 rooms downstairs and 2 upstairs.Others are much bigger.They have now been modernised. A large part of the village consists of a National Coal Board estate built in the late 1930's.These houses are plaster covered and usually painted white.This gives rise to the term 'white city'.This is a common name in this area for this type of housing. The third large section of housing is a council estate built in the 1930's. This is made up of 3 bedroom linked or semi-detached houses built of red brick.
